docs.text: Hub and Spoke with Terraform ¶ Overview ¶ A hub and spoke topology is a way to isolate workloads that are sharing common or shared services such as IAM, security, bastion servers, dns, etc. Using a hub and spoke virtual network (VNet) model, the hub can serve acts as a central connection point to an on-premises network and for other spokes (app) to consume shared services. Subsequent spokes will only consist of app spectific code and services. The app spoke VNets will peer with the hub. This repo contain the necessary terraform code to help you build out an Azure platform using a hub and spoke model. It was adopted from the following tutorial. https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/terraform/terraform-hub-spoke-introduction The hub folder contain the terraform files to build and setup vnet peering between the spoke and hub vnets on-premise vnet to simulate an on premise datacenter hub vnet spoke1 vnet spoke2 vnet The webapp1_spoke folder contain webapp1 spoke 2 web server that is part of a vmscale set instructions ¶ from Azure Cloud Shell, run terraform init terraform plan terraform apply more info ¶ Based on the following Microsoft tutorial on build hub and spoke vnets https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/terraform/terraform-hub-spoke-introduction
